casebody.data:
PAUL KAHN, RELATOR, v. EDWARD A. McGRATH, JUDGE OF THE ELIZABETH DISTRICT COURT, AND GEORGE J. SMITH, CLERK OF THE ELIZABETH DISTRICT COURT, DEFENDANTS. Submitted June 2, 1927 Decided November 25, 1927.

Before Justices Teenchard, Kalirch and Katzbnbach.

Eor the relator, Michael H. Feldman. Eor the defendants, Henry IValdman. Per Curiam.

We incline to think that there is presented by the matters laid before us sufficient to justify the award of an alternative writ of mandamus, and it will be awarded accordingly.
